channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: Stochastic Volatility Applied to Bitcoin
item.description: Time varying volatility (variance), is one of the characteristics of financial time series. Another characteristic is that it is autocorrelated in time. This leads to what is known as volatility clustring, meaning that if we observe a big change in returns today, there is a higher probability of observing a big change tomorrow, and vise versa for small changes. In this post we will look at one specific model for estimating time varying volatility, namely the stochastic volatility model.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to my webpage! I’m Jens Christian Wahl, currently working as a research scientist at the Norwegian Computing Center in the department for Statistical Analysis, Machine Learning and Image Analysis (SAMBA). This blog will mainly serve as a place where I try to present things I find interesting. I finished my master thesis in statistics in 2018, where I investigated different methods for parameter estimation of multivariate stochastic volatility. This webpage is written in R markdown using the blogdown package.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
